page.title: 16SUNDAY IN FLAMSTEAD
page.content: During a typical Flamstead Sunday people tend to unwind after the working week.Many families sleep in longer although some still attend the local morning services at 9.30am in church or chapel at 10.30am.There is still quite a tradition in the village for Sunday roast lunch with meat bought from the popular local butcher. There are few activities in the village although the children play with friends on the recreation ground or in the surrounding countryside.We are near to many local attractions for example Whipsnade Zoo & Woburn Safari Park so parent often take children out.Many villagers are keen gardeners and Sunday afternoons are often spent in this pursuit or in car washing and polishing.In Winter there is little to do in the village.
